newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks end lower, blue chips lead decline.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks end lower, blue chips lead decline.

text.p: Seoul shares ended Thursday's trading lower after profit-taking in blue chips eroded earlier narrow gains, brokers said.
The composite index fell 6.00 points to a provisional close of 657.90. Decliners beat advancers 487 to 302. Volume was an active 32 million shares.
Brokers said the market's fundamental weakness caught up with trading again after Wednesday's brief rebound.
"Fundamentally the market is at a bottom, and sentiment is what is moving the index up and down," a KLB Securities fund manager said.
Preparation for Thursday's settlement deadline for March futures contracts sent blue chips climbing on Wednesday.
The June futures contracts closed 0.40 of a point lower at 64.15 on Thursday, while the underlying KOSPI-200 index fell 0.52 of a point to 66.31.
Brokers said the market was still plagued by a slowing economy, high interest rates and a weakening won.

Samsung Electronics declined on profit-taking after Wednesday's gains. It lost 1,200 won to 52,500. Yukong fell 400 won to 14,900, Hyundai Motor shed 500 won to 24,000, and KEPCO fell 400 won to 25,600.
Individual theme-backed shares had climbed during Thursday's morning trading, but declined later as weak fundamentals overwhelmed the buying sentiment.
Some pharmaceutical shares, which rose on talk of new drug discoveries, fell. Han All Pharmaceuticals, which had risen to 12,000 won per share, closed 400 won lower at 11,100.

Shindongbang shares ended 1,400 won lower at 34,100. A company official told Reuters its hostile takeover bid for Midopa Department Store was unlikely to be settled by a compromise. Midopa lost 2,300 won to 27,600, while its parent Dainong shed 220 won to 6,900.
